CSS_font-faceFont-stretch.summary: The font-stretch CSS descriptor allows authors to specify a normal, condensed, or expanded face for the fonts specified in the @font-face at-rule.

remarks.para: For a particular font family, authors can download various font faces which correspond to the different styles of the same font family, and then use the font-stretch descriptor to explicitly specify the font face's stretch. The values for the CSS descriptor is same as that of its corresponding font property.

CSS_font-faceFont-stretch.value: In earlier versions of the font-stretch specification, the property accepts only the nine keyword values. CSS Fonts Level 4 extends the syntax to accept a <percentage> value as well. This enables variable fonts to offer something more like a continuum of character widths. For TrueType or OpenType variable fonts, the "wdth" variation is used to implement varying widths.If the font does not provide a face that exactly matches the given value, then values less than 100% map to a narrower face, and values greater than or equal to 100% map to a wider face.
